thread.title: College Notebook: National volleyball honor for SUNY Poly's Eberley
thread.title_full: College Notebook: National volleyball honor for SUNY Poly's Eberley

author: Ron Moshier
title: College Notebook: National volleyball honor for SUNY Poly's Eberley
text: Follow @@OD_Moshier Posted Oct. 7, 2015 at 10:58 PM SUNY Polytechnic Institute senior Morgan Eberley (Utica/Whitesboro) led her women’s volleyball team to four more victories last week – extending the Wildcats’ winning streak to 16 matches – and Tuesday the outside hitter was named the national NCAA Division III Player of the Week by the American Volleyball Coaches Association (AVCA). During SUNY Poly’s 4-0 week, the 5-foot-6 Eberley had 62 kills, a .343 hitting percentage, 44 digs, six aces and five assists. She averaged 4.77 kills per set and her 17 kills, .412 hitting percentage and eight digs helped the Wildcats to a 3-0 sweep over Hamilton College. Later in the week, Eberley had a career-high 24 kills, 18 digs, three assists and a pair of aces in a dramatic 3-2 win over Plattsburgh State. Eberley, also honored by the North Eastern Athletic Conference (NEAC) as its Player of the Week, ended the period as the NEAC leader in kills (223), kills per set (3.78), points (255) and points per set (4.3). Eberley and SUNY Poly sophomore Megan Will (Remsen) have helped the Wildcats go 6-0 in the league and 16-2 overall, and they play at Utica College at 7 p.m. today. Football Lawrence Elliott Jr. (Utica/Thomas R. Proctor) ran for 73 yards and a touchdown on 11 carries in Bloomsburg University’s 63-0 win over Cheyney State. The junior running back also had two catches for 33 yards. Utica College sophomore Matt McCoy (Sherrill/Vernon-Verona-Sherrill) had seven tackles and an interception and broke up two passes in a 30-27 overtime win over previously-unbeaten Ithaca. Nick Woodman (Utica/Thomas R. Proctor) and Nick Bruzzese (Utica/Thomas R. Proctor) each had five tackles for the Pioneers, and Woodman had 1½ sacks. Dylan Peebles (Port Leyden/South Lews) rushed for 66 yards and a touchdown and also had a 57-yard kickoff return to help 22nd-ranked Cortland State stay unbeaten with a 48-45 overtime win over Hartwick College. Malone University’s Dan Mower (Holland Patent) had eight tackles in a 42-17 loss to 13th-ranked Ashland College. Men’s Golf Junior Derek Bard (New Hartford) shot a team-best 2-under 69 and placed fifth overall while leading the University of Virginia to a first-place tie with Vanderbilt in the stroke play portion of the annual DICK’S Sports Goods Challenge Cup in Nashville, Tennessee. Bard finished five shots back of the medalist with the three-round total of 3-under 210. Field Hockey Senior goakkeeper Jess Jecko (Clinton/Sauquoit Valley) has started every game for an unbeaten Syracuse University team that is 11-0 and ranked No. 1 in the country. Jecko has made 32 saves and has three shutouts and a goals-against average of 0.84. Central Michigan University’s Kaysie Gregory (Rome/Rome Free Academy) scored her seventh goal in a 3-1 loss to Ohio University. Page 2 of 2 - Lexi Kavanaugh (Sherrill/Vernon-Verona-Sherrill) scored her sixth goal of the season in Ball State University’s 3-2 loss to Virginia Commonwealth. Freshman Jess Welsh (Hamilton) scored her fifth goal of the season in Cortland State’s 3-0 win over Nazareth College. St. John Fisher College keeper Danielle Famolaro (Rome/Rome Free Academy) made one save and recorded her third shutout as the Cardinals blanked Utica College 3-0. Morrisville State sophomore Lauren Kellum (Eaton/Morrisville-Eaton) was named the North Eastern Athletic Conference Offensive Player of the Week. She scored three goals in a 5-2 win over Keuka College. Women’s Soccer William Smith College junior Shay Callahan (Holland Patent) had an assist in a 6-0 win over RPI that helped the nationally-ranked No. 6 Herons (7-1-1) extend their unbeaten streak to eight games. Paige Sullivan (Poland) scored a goal and Nazareth College improved to 8-1-2 with a 5-0 win at Alfred University. Junior striker Kayli Smith (Rome/Rome Free Academy) scored twice to help Albany College School of Pharmacy & Health Sciences to a 6-0 win over the University of Maine at Presque Isle. Kaitlyn Lyon (Dolgeville) and Ciera Sportello (Newport/West Canada Valley) scored goals in Cazenovia College’s 10-0 win over the College of St. Elizabeth. A hat trick by Jillian Hughes (Brookfield) led Morrisville State to an 8-1 win over the College of St. Elizabeth. Kelly Brennan (Sauquoit/Sauquoit Valley) also had a goal and Sara Murphy (Oriskany) had an assist for the Mustangs. Men’s Soccer Morrisville State College keeper Rob Larkin (Clinton) made six saves in a 2-0 win over Utica College. It was his third shutout in four games and the 17th of his career. Junior Zak Giorgi (Whitesboro) scored his 11th and 12th goals of the season and also had two assists while helping Albany College of Pharmacy & Health Sciences roll to a 10-0 win over Davis College. Follow @OD_Moshier on Twitter or call him at 792-5031.
